title: Antotena
author: Antotena
content: Source: https://x.com/buacement/status/1708531608649695372It's not a new thing about monopoly in nigeria where some group of people dominate the market to frustrate the living but I like this strategy even when it is shorter term.BUA is having a new plant under construction but the old factory (ex factory)are still producing cement and have crash their cement price to ₦3500 untill first quarter of next year 2024, so basically everyone get to buy BUA cement at that price unlike Dangote that is selling for ₦5000. I want to see if Dangote will remain at ₦5000 from now till next year or will slash it's price.This is a good marketing strategy to bring customers closer to BUA from Dangote that dominate almost every commodity in Nigeria.

comments.author: Kara3
comments.body: This is really a welcome development, at least Bua group of company have the people of naija at heart, the suffering in the country is too much, so any role anyone at the top can play to reduce the burden of the common man is a very good thing , even though it just temporary it's ok, at least he tried, unlike most of his pearls.

Million of Nigeria will make use of the opportunity, I have a friend who purchased a land and was ready to build then the price of cement then increase, my friend have to stop with work due to the increase in the price of cement. When I so this I was very happy that finally my friend will start is building work. Bua you are a hero, you will not know what you have done for millions Nigeria.Federal government should copy from him, If one person can do this and non individual in Nigeria will say his richer than Nigeria if really our resources are manage well, so learn from him by subsidise food products even though it is a short time we will also appreciate.

comments.author: Forever101
comments.body: Bua is on the goal to overtake dangote cement but I bet with you that dangote will come up with new strategy to beat them, its just a competitive market. Kudos to Bua as they bring comfort to the people of naija. We hope to see other big companies emulate them to ease the hardship for the common man in Nigeria. This singular act of Bua require continuous thanks as they have the people of naija at heart and they are ready to help prosperity and housing spread in the land. Good job Bua cement.Our prayer now should be about suppliers as they also cause this price manipulation.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: I saw the news and if really this news is legit and it really come to pass, then this will be one of the best news in the year. And BUA is going to make name and sell market from cement industry. I know strongly well that oga kpatakpata (Dangote) will also reduce his to the speculated price #2,500 and there will be a competition in the market. Dongote is one of the problem we dey get for we country. Me too as other said, I no come like di guy because nai dey make things cost well well for country. I just pray sae make another cement industry sef come and join di competition so that Dangote go dey reduce im own well. One thing wey I dey feel be sae, the supply e no go reach the way dangote dey supply im own. Because community nobody dey sell am and only dangote cement nai dey there. so di matter still e get as e bi.  Maked di supply e dey rampant for all di corners.

comments.author: GiftedMAN
comments.body: I read this news today and all I can say for now is let's hope that our president doesn't change his mind about this development all decide to retrieve the license that is given to the director of BUA cement so that only dangote will continue to be the only existing cement in the country thereby making the price of cement to be increasing every time.One good thing about the news is that they gave the current date that the price will be reduced hopefully all the citizens will abandon dangote cement to buy BUA cement where the price is some how affordable, I hope dangote won't reduce the price of his products since he wants a bag of cement to be sold for #9000 while some time ago news came out that the same cement that is sold for #5000 in Nigeria being dangote's country is sold at 1500 in Benin Republic which is not his country.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: Antotena on October 01, 2023, 06:57:58 PMIt's not a new thing about monopoly in nigeria where some group of people dominate the market to frustrate the living but I like this strategy even when it is shorter term.BUA is having a new plant under construction but the old factory (ex factory)are still producing cement and have crash their cement price to ₦3500 untill first quarter of next year 2024, so basically everyone get to buy BUA cement at that price unlike Dangote that is selling for ₦5000. I want to see if Dangote will remain at ₦5000 from now till next year or will slash it's price.This is a good marketing strategy to bring customers closer to BUA from Dangote that dominate almost every commodity in Nigeria.The news is a very welcome one and a news that will bring about relief in some parts that it’s used for (for building and infrastructure). This will further cushion the effect of fuel subsidy that was removed earlier thereby getting a bag of cement for almost same price it was before the fuel subsidy was removed when correlated together. Subsidizing the price of goods like this should have been the main aim of the subsidy removal in order for citizens to not feel and go through the hassle they are now as a result of the subsidy that was removed. This is the best possible palliative approach that if they employ to other sectors it’ll help cushion the effect of the fuel subsidy removal. I hope the big rebels (wealthy monopolists) don’t hijacked this cements and later sell at high price to end users again because it is something they can do.Quote from: Mate2237 on October 01, 2023, 10:14:49 PM One thing wey I dey feel be sae, the supply e no go reach the way dangote dey supply im own. Because community nobody dey sell am and only dangote cement nai dey there. so di matter still e get as e bi.  Maked di supply e dey rampant for all di corners.For my place, d way Dangote cement dey everywhere naso BUA cement dey too. There was a time when Dangote Cement sold expired cements to customers, those cements were supposed to be disposed and not sold again but maybe some factory workers smuggled them out and still sold to end users, which affected many buildings and constructions they were used for because I also experienced one that time. Since then, builders here always prefer to use BUA cement than Dangote cement because of what happened, as some people still felt it was their builders that didn’t know how to the work not knowing or believing it was the expired cement sold that caused it. BUA cement here gets finished on time because of its demand than Dangote cement which is always available but no much patronage than before. BUA cement is even N100 more costly than Dangote cement due to its demand here.

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: OMO this news has been all the fuss everywhere and na very good news because to buy cement bag for the country come they turn to something else, sometimes the thing just dey baffle me because am still suprise how a country wey get all the raw materials to produce that product give him citizens come they use am means to exploit from it citizens and the one way dey pain me pass na the issue with dangote cement group because I know how legit the rumour be but I don hear am for many times say dangote dey actually sell cement for cheap price for country outside Nigeria and back home here him wan cut our necks which if na true is the height of wickedness. I just thank GOD say BUA cement don take this move for the cement industry because this move go definitely influence the other competitors to actually look into their prices.

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: I have always been a supporter of fair market competition, no favouritism! During Obasanjo's regime, Ibeto cement was doing well. They partnered with some industries in the US to flood the Nigerian market with quality and cheap cement. They even brought in their vessels loaded with cement to Onne Port Rivers State but the then government seized the vessels using some flimsy excuses and that was how the whole cement spoilt and the man was forced to give up.If the present administration is opening the market to fair competition, then it is a welcomed development.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: After I read this news online with the circular, many thoughts came over me and I was wondering what prompted this action from this man because I believe something must have made him to do this. For him to have taken this measures to drastically cut down the price in the cost of his product then it means the price of cement is far cheaper than what they sell which shows that  the price hike was intentional and were bent on imposing high price on their commodity because they are just few in the line of business and as such would have the market dominance and nobody to compete with them.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: If all business men in the country will be like AA RANO oil and BUA cement then the poor in the country will indeed have some air to breath,  this move by BUA cement is going to set them at a position that will place the company on a market take over in the long term unless if the competitors do what is more than what BUA cement have done presently and even at that also we have to encourage the company for taking the bold steps to stand by Nigerian in the economic hard time. Let hope other companies such as Dangote will follow this footsteps also in reducing the price of his cements, and other basic good to help corsion the effects and impact of the current economic crisis that have been triggered by subsidy removal and so on.
